document.title: Georgiaâ€™s K-12 Standards for English Language Arts (SY2025-2026)

FA3C178C5E3F400285CE4A8B46BCD861.description: Explore various sources of information, including print, digital, and personal communication, and discuss connections to various topics. (I)

21FBB21F19384BC0B8B9F2287515E67D.description: Refer to specific parts of texts when supporting an idea, answer, or opinion. (I)

683C95EFAD4249A6AB75A08B0B2B21AC.description: Curating Sources & Evidence Reference parts of texts to address a specific topic or question and explore various sources of information to make connections across a broad range of topics.

71064A751EBF446E8B1D2BC710329975.description: Organize and share related, relevant, and accurate information through a variety of different modes. (C)

EBA94A560B1A4341B2AFBF131B1C29B2.description: Work collaboratively or individually to conduct research to answer questions on a shared or personal topic of interest by gathering and organizing information from multiple sources using graphic organizers or other support aids. (I)

F765A37ADFF54F25BCA728C2B302B08D.description: Generate questions about self-selected topics of interest for research. (I)

13764082915B4A2EAF0741210F55279F.description: Research & Inquiry Build knowledge about the world by asking or generating questions about topics of interest, researching the answers, using multiple sources, and communicating relevant and accurate information about the topic.

BA83199F251C4270BD40F73D95380AC8.description: Research & Analysis Students use, discuss, analyze, and curate texts as they engage in various conversations, activities, and projects about a range of grade-level texts and topics.

45D163B5D7574B5F9CAF2FDACBF368B6.description: Use poetic techniques to create poems using words and/or phrases that may or may not rhyme. (C)

989486C5E9B04B0A83B404130ACB2CB9.description: Identify, classify, and describe poetic techniques used to craft texts, including rhyme, alliteration, repeated lines, stanzas, and line breaks. (I)

F44EA0CD244F4A1AB7F0364E9D559CBD.description: Poetic Techniques Identify and use poetic techniques to shape understanding.

040010F871084342A8E2846BB99C5CBB.description: Use knowledge of opinion techniques to create opinion pieces that introduce the topic, state an opinion about the topic, supply reasons to support the opinion with linking words (e.g., because, and, also), and provide a conclusion. (C)

53B28C7ECB2649B1A0F041E463B648B5.description: Identify and describe techniques used to craft opinion texts, including the authorâ€™s opinion, supporting reasons, and facts. (I)

3F8DDFA46DE24A348591FAD5FC61FA5C.description: Opinion Techniques Identify and use opinion techniques to shape understanding.

61465AD27B014B3BB370651606303472.description: Use knowledge of expository techniques to create texts that introduce a topic, use facts and definitions to develop the topic, and provide a concluding statement or section. (C)

D9FF8F81E80D406F8C62EBE8A9A65B5D.description: Describe the connection between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in technical procedures in a text. (I)

EAAF309239A842C0968D7FEDB62E102D.description: Identify and describe techniques used to craft expository texts, including main idea and key supporting details within specific paragraphs. (I)

EFB3CBAE82C644338F44C23EDED36CFB.description: Expository Techniques Identify and use expository techniques to shape understanding.

DBC98BA6919C451596756EC94735F844.description: Use knowledge of narrative techniques (e.g., characters, settings, events, dialogue) to create texts that recount real or imagined experiences and events with a sense of closure. (C)

68DD3DAD03354274819ADE2C16073903.description: Compare and contrast two or more versions of the same story by different authors or from diverse cultures. (I)

58C39B82FF674B6CA80F9137C0C9BCB8.description: Identify and describe how charactersâ€™ responses to major challenges or events support the central message, lesson, or moral of the story. (I)

AE9214AFFDA44516AE19AA0E6A2BEA7D.description: Identify the major plot events that occur between a problem and solution. (I)

C6F49FB2C198433691B2ABB941B1D630.description: Identify and describe techniques used to craft stories, including characters, setting, major events, and dialogue. (I)

1ED20283564343668135FA6A8774FDE4.description: Narrative Techniques Identify and use narrative techniques to shape understanding.

0F4B8BB0D9CB4A16BE1DA9BC680FB0BD.description: Techniques Students identify and use narrative, expository, opinion, and poetic techniques as they interpret and construct a variety of texts.

74F56556AF904A75A829BF7A58F043F4.description: Use descriptive words to craft engaging texts. (C)

7989245A15904660BCCA1F0301939F0A.description: Identify the difference between literal and nonliteral or figurative language in texts. (I)

3EC6C5A0D5544E549DF4E6F958FB1F50.description: Craft Identify and use descriptive and engaging language.

6241942131D340EFBE0E672E210B80E8.description: Use conjunctions and transition words or phrases to sequence events and actions. (C)

461F3D8EA47B444AB449C3DE40A39704.description: Use text features (e.g., illustrations, page numbers, bold print, headings) to add clarity and meaning to texts. (C)

6605CE64248C490BA8E45E18EE187338.description: Explain how various text features (e.g., captions, subheadings, charts, indexes) contribute to meaning and organization of texts. (I)

414FEE2E498B4909BE21A446C5406543.description: Organization Identify and use organizational structures to craft meaning.

A79396471D1C4AF5B29AFAC01771D66E.description: Structure & Style Students build and apply knowledge about language and organizational structures and elements used to convey and arrange ideas and information in texts.

4FEE2B28022B450BA151C6178C2C245B.description: Use examples of language from the text to identify various points of view (e.g., first person, third person). (I)

61E39223C0504868ACD0643265A8DE54.description: Authors & Speakers Investigate the relationships between authors and speakers in texts.

2376CE2114D240798396834F68C9B484.description: Choose two or more modes and create a multimodal text on a self-selected topic. (C)

72AEC80549204EC9A699467430DB2CF3.description: Recognize different modes of communication: print, digital, auditory, spoken, visual, and multimodal. (I)

0B413B709A2B44FAA127D6A64BAF547F.description: Determine the general purpose and target audience in a variety of texts. (I)

E5B91BEEE67341FEB4E4144275C79325.description: Purpose & Audience Explain how authors of texts use language for a specific purpose and a target audience.

F1351A15058A4F96B2CE570E920F8D46.description: Context Students explore the relationships and roles of authors, purposes, and audiences of texts.

59765D4FB9E745B696CC615740A01AE8.description: Texts (T) Students grow in their learning as they purposefully engage with texts.

E04191A2F170419386E64676C67EFF98.description: Use knowledge of word relationships and learned vocabulary words and phrases when making word choices in speaking and writing. (C)

3B459FCAB39A42089959482E4106CEBA.description: Use glossaries and beginning dictionaries, both print and digital, to determine or clarify the meaning of words and phrases. (I)

F15E9EF7A8F946578183CAB4EF0B9C6A.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs that differ in manner (e.g., look, peek, glance, stare, glare, scowl) and adjectives that differ in intensity (e.g., large, gigantic). (I)

0F1A51CD8BB94AB9A0CB01EC2293CEA8.description: Determine the relationship between words and their synonyms and antonyms. (I)

46AE91816FE34DA7A905C434F1352300.description: Use context within and beyond a sentence to determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases. (I)

894482508713496DAE57D8390E44785C.description: Meaning & Purpose Make connections between words and phrases and use reference materials to determine or clarify word meanings in a variety of settings and for a variety of purposes.

4FEC3D25B01344088D39FBD451F5F677.description: Construct words using frequently occurring root words and affixes. (C)

8C5F01F6C96B4F05B68D5CAC0FDEE6A7.description: Identify and use frequently occurring root words and affixes (e.g., prefixes, suffixes) to deconstruct words to determine or clarify meaning. (I)

9CCC3407F5304B3381A9C083D03B065A.description: Word Analysis Acquire and apply word analysis skills to deconstruct and construct words to make meaning.

BBC45501732C45A69EEE94E47429B4F7.description: Use grade-level general, academic, and specialized vocabulary words and phrases to communicate in a variety of settings. (C)

E21C68C58CD04AA289DD8FB103E45940.description: Acquire general, academic, and specialized vocabulary words and phrases through grade-level texts and content. (I)

233AF1AD84F94E48A9276EFC0C834B15.description: General, Academic, & Specialized Vocabulary Acquire and use general, academic, and specialized vocabulary words and phrases in a variety of settings.

610FB11B120742A7B92D528E81D1254A.description: Vocabulary Students engage in a wide range of written and spoken activities during which they expand and deepen their vocabularies, build word analysis skillsets (morphology), and determine or clarify the meanings of words and phrases.

329ED85E8CC74858ABC5915172C7D0CD.description: Develop ideas or information in texts by using adjectives or adverbs to add details or clarify meaning. (C)

371A6E8C0B244316886E442A18E41B4C.description: Use correct subject and verb agreement in sentence constructions. (C)

1824FAE041F14180ACD5CC2F0338DB72.description: Use a variety of simple and compound sentences (including a variety of sentence types) to develop clarity and coherence in written texts. (C)

5E0DA8AED0CD443BB4F441552FEC2760.description: Distinguish between simple and compound sentences, and identify the sentence type (i.e., declarative, imperative, interrogative, and exclamatory). (I)

7127D5FE80DE49CDB01D5E9ECAFEBA83.description: Syntax Recognize and compose coherent sentences that express complete thoughts.

680E0AA1E4B144B7BFAB0F498007A42F.description: Mechanics: Recognize and use conventional capitalization, quotation marks, and commas to indicate exact words and dialogue. (Introduce)

F6ACFBEAB1144C6482B94726B56EBDB2.description: Grammar: Form and use comparative and superlative adjectives and adverbs. (Introduce)

7FE4B8B252164EC88C52AF8F6054B1E8.description: Grammar: Form and use prepositional phrases. (Introduce)

D1A65699E32D41DDB48933240FDFCABF.description: Mechanics: Use hyphens to divide words at line breaks. (Introduce)

DE7854D76E1C4851B7623C20E3922AC0.description: Mechanics: Use commas with coordinating conjunctions to join independent clauses. (Introduce)

720D0D3EF4414E208360EC0937A78059.description: Grammar: Use collective and abstract nouns. (Introduce)

605E577FBE59442F9092C740FE6FD296.description: Grammar: Form and use verbs by adding -d or -es. (Introduce, Master)

4644456DBA004BB9BC8814712B1472DB.description: Grammar: Use coordinating conjunctions to join words, phrases, or clauses. (Continue)

A26CC46E943646A28A747C0B5B361513.description: Grammar: Form and use the past tense of irregular verbs. (Continue)

688B03C7983D49529165F675131C9DDB.description: Grammar: Form and use irregular plural nouns. (Continue)

C9FEFD8D6E61451CA52EEE0A23926A4E.description: Mechanics: Use apostrophes to form contractions and singular possessive nouns. (Continue)

DCEBD35D686643A0AC30C8E0E1DF400D.description: Mechanics: Use commas to separate items in a series and to format dates, addresses, salutations, and closings. (Master)

28EEA60B2407478A9E72B3B456829EFD.description: Grammar: Use personal pronouns (subject, object, and possessive). (Master)

D6B0500432B04376919E4F19BD262317.description: Grammar: Form plural nouns by changing -y to -ies. (Master)

12B87765A9574858AEDBF60A54CDBDFD.description: Mechanics: Use periods, exclamation marks, and question marks at the end of sentences. (Master)

5C41A0D38BA941A2945EFCDE1C928504.description: Usage: Use determiners (articles, possessive determiners, demonstrative adjectives). (Master)

58A97D148ED542B1A2274A96D21478D8.description: Grammar: Form and use the simple verb tenses. (Master)

0C5444E98E5349EAB53C81F81D01E7C0.description: Grammar: Use common and proper nouns. (Master)

7283A5CAC1A5446888969C1D2DA6C3CB.description: Grammar, Usage, & Mechanics Learn and apply conventions of Standard English grammar, usage, and mechanics to aid the comprehension of texts and to communicate clearly in written and spoken language.

F8096D8200DA4648BE1E1D5FA7942753.description: Grammar Conventions Students observe, analyze, and use the structures and conventions of Standard English grammar, usage, and mechanics as they interpret and construct texts.

F838627CECA5452187CFA16F16800993.description: Language (L) Students learn and apply the structures and conventions of standard English. Students observe and analyze how grammar works in reading and writing. Students build vocabularies and determine word meanings as they relate to reading and writing.

9BA7D282DBEA4C7DBF32B29ACF2927E5.description: Build background knowledge by reciting all or part of significant poems and speeches as appropriate by grade level. (I/C)

EBB97E41B9FB4567B6BF33816A1DA48F.description: Engage in dialogue with audiences by asking and answering questions. (I/C)

29F78C94B42C44BC9B725A029EDB498C.description: Vary tone, pace, and nonverbal gestures as appropriate to purpose and audience. (I/C)

9E97936AD705464F8302585B16C09AA7.description: Integrate modes and genres most appropriate to purpose and audience. (I/C)

3B15840B13A24DDEA662A5B6B48D08A0.description: Communicate clearly to present ideas, information, and texts. (I/C)

7B79BF05681A4CE5805008CC8E19D556.description: Presentation Use presentation skills to tailor communication to target audiences for specific purposes.

D8E0C1FCBBE944E29BA7A2DBC3E1844F.description: Work with others to discuss topics, investigate questions, solve problems, and explore and create texts. (I/C)

60F2EBF9372D46888A9DF4289D6E047A.description: Contribute to discussions and shared projects by offering ideas, listening to the ideas of others, and providing feedback. (I/C)

97AC81C289494F2284B53BD05720BE62.description: Collaborate with others to determine group norms, establish goals and procedures, and facilitate productivity when working on shared projects. (I/C)

C01DD59F4180439597B9A37F63BB78D2.description: Arrive to group discussions and collaborative meetings prepared to be an active participant in the work. (I/C)

6527D244E52342A7BBFE02095CDAF6D8.description: Collaboration Collaborate with others to accomplish shared goals and projects.

3EEC96FD6C0946EE875106545E839FCA.description: Collaboration & Presentation Students build and share knowledge as they engage with others in a range of settings and for a variety of purposes.

EE4E211C6ABB49FFBA417F8B5B599DD0.description: Consume and produce multimodal texts, integrating a variety of genres, text features, and craft techniques to influence target audiences and achieve specific purposes. (I/C)

C71895CB9B3B4881A9A9405531B1129C.description: Apply knowledge of how mode and genre impact how ideas and information are structured and arranged in texts. (I/C)

BF8AC6134FB045F1933E2D7397AEFE80.description: Apply knowledge of how mode and genre impact what kinds of ideas and information are included in texts. (I/C)

4ACC1D00396C477A88F919B06E022A6B.description: Explore and create texts in various modes and genres, developing and applying knowledge of how specific features impact meaning, tone, style, purpose, and audience. (I/C)

C58FF6F59BC14C648FE3E6267F8F12EB.description: Text Design Consider the impact of text design on audience and purpose when consuming and producing texts across modes and genres.

0A4F3B1CC4F448E7AC6BB35F336E84DC.description: Organize texts by incorporating specific formats, structures, patterns, and features to influence the audience, facilitate accessibility, and support the textâ€™s purpose. (I/C)

393C07462C324C0CBA29AA3ADC58EE17.description: Make decisions about sentence structure and syntax in order to accommodate and influence the audience and achieve a specific purpose. (I/C)

822FA12D75B34EC48D198328877B6A73.description: Craft words and phrases in order to influence the responses, thoughts, decisions, and questions of the target audience and achieve a specific purpose. (I/C)

6F6906BE512F4FD580A65C401D6C2D61.description: Integrate literary, expository, and opinion (grades K-5) or rhetorical (grades 6-12) elements to appeal to target audiences and achieve specific purposes. (I/C)

D99AF5929F2742269E7549B3E5DC95B5.description: Writing like a Reader Construct texts with the audienceâ€™s experience in mind, basing decisions about craft techniques on context and purpose.

7002BFEDC2784C80848C8DDC4A76AEAB.description: Describe, analyze, and evaluate the design and organization of the text, explaining how specific formats, structures, patterns, and features influence the audience, contribute to the textâ€™s accessibility, and support the textâ€™s purpose. (I/C)

B9B06F795B1346FA819D06547112B4ED.description: Explain, analyze, and evaluate how the authorâ€™s use of sentence structure and syntax affects the target audience and supports the textâ€™s purpose. (I/C)

39586FA6715B491E8515D27B2924214F.description: Identify, apply, and analyze important, interesting, or effective uses of language, explaining or evaluating how specific word choices affect the target audience and support the textâ€™s purpose. (I/C)

BDC5B55E184749748E5FEBF2B7D497B0.description: Identify, apply, and analyze the literary, expository, and opinion (grades K-5) or rhetorical (grades 6-12) elements in texts, explaining or evaluating how specific elements affect the target audience and support the textâ€™s purpose. (I/C)

3F9FEFDC0692412FAE9006391ABADAC4.description: Reading like a Writer Interpret texts through the authorâ€™s lens by identifying, analyzing, and evaluating craft techniques that are connected to the responses, thoughts, decisions, and questions triggered by the text.

F6A27CB794624C65B2EC0ED6F73F4E17.description: Authorâ€™s Craft Students apply knowledge of authorâ€™s craft to enhance the interpretation and construction of texts.

997A743FB59A4BA7A9123E76D3F5EC33.description: Draw from knowledge of how authors consider context and audience to determine which information and ideas to highlight, which text design is most accessible, which word choices and language structures are most effective, and which craft techniques are most impactful. (I/C)

C616133B89484814BE0D464FE5FA2DB8.description: Draw from knowledge of author, audience, and context to discern and establish a clear point of view or unique perspective when interpreting and constructing texts. (I/C)

951F1062861D4B1E9E0B074023948522.description: Develop and apply knowledge of author, audience, and context to discern and establish the purpose of texts being interpreted or constructed and to evaluate the extent to which those texts achieve those purposes. (I/C)

B5DD6E21F3B14C47BBD0743206468472.description: Author, Audience, & Purpose Interpret and construct texts by developing and applying knowledge of the strategies and techniques authors use to accommodate the target audience and achieve the textâ€™s purpose.

96DDD0109C4B47DFB8B3C0BEED1DF4EA.description: Explore how context shapes the authorâ€™s decisions and the audienceâ€™s responses during the interpretation and construction of texts. (I/C)

444242D823C644BFA8EBF68D0F6C337D.description: Consider how context impacts the purposes of the author and the audience. (I/C)

3F8B5145F95D4DEBB99F4B4E04F0BB13.description: Use prior knowledge, formal or informal research, and discussions with others to identify the key components of context that are most relevant. (I/C)

5B65724A25FC4082AA7169AEA3EFCB0F.description: Context Develop and apply knowledge of key components of context such as background information, geographic location, cultural influences, time period, and contemporary events when interpreting and constructing texts.

87B6A60792A94E8BB0BD286D383125D7.description: Situating Texts Students develop and apply a multilayered understanding of context, author, audience, and purpose to ground and propel the interpretation and construction of texts.

A1286D81984A4FC4A5788435556C3F05.description: Edit the text, ensuring it adheres to the conventions of written language. (C)

404E7F688BF54E388E5FCA87E34F9A3E.description: Make changes to the text based on self-evaluation or external feedback, revising the organization, ideas, information, word choices, and craft techniques in order to increase the textâ€™s effectiveness. (C)

6D89DEA9B04F44C4AE9AEE01D267687F.description: Evaluate the textâ€™s effectiveness based on self-review or feedback from others, determining whether the text matches the purpose and goals for writing. (C)

5C65F535692141A992D16B5D83A8C501.description: Construct an initial draft by integrating ideas and information; selecting words, phrases, and sentences; and incorporating craft techniques that will best achieve the purpose of the text and resonate with the target audience. (C)

5E26D7BC1809413F87494FA35D7104E3.description: Link ideas and information to the organization plan, highlighting ideas and information that are most relevant, useful, and impactful. (C)

0721873FC2D44C558DA50C6FB59792F1.description: Generate ideas for content by assessing prior knowledge, gathering information from texts, and engaging in discussions with others. (C)

BC11E941F40F404B97537CA7614D478E.description: Plan how to organize the text by selecting modes, genres, and structures that will achieve the purpose and meet the needs of the target audience. (C)

A06DEDBBAD1F4A7DB51821D825525E8E.description: Establish a purpose and goals for writing and identify a target audience. (C)

5FFAF1C8300647EE9BA2CD47D45B8C63.description: Writing Processes Compose a range of texts for a variety of purposes and audiences, flexibly engaging in writing processes to plan, draft, evaluate, revise, and edit texts.

E768624EE784470BAA85E4CF0EE54901.description: Determine the meanings of unfamiliar words and concepts by applying knowledge of context and of academic vocabulary and word parts. (I)

A1F6CF3484714546A3FA77EEB9FDA91B.description: Make, track, and support inferences about different levels of meaning within the text. (I)

A9C529DE03C2405D93C246474415CE5B.description: Make and track predictions about the events and information likely to come next. (I)

C15D27C248E4465FBEB3F183258DA798.description: Summarize and visualize sections of the text to maintain understanding. (I)

3C477B9233D2400F8C359A51D9031543.description: Draw from, compare, build, and integrate prior knowledge with the material in the text, addressing inconsistencies or gaps and adding to knowledge repertoires as appropriate. (I)

5167BF6EF619439496EC13D476242F34.description: Scan and skim the text, making note of structures and sections that might be most useful. (I)

3FE3DB4C027C45E2A51967D27AD60BD5.description: Establish a purpose and set goals for reading, monitor comprehension, and adjust as needed. (I)

E6AF613B16FB4A4E94364CE787E18819.description: Comprehension Strategies Engage with a range of complex texts for a variety of tasks and purposes, accessing and using strategies for comprehension* before, during, and after reading as part of the meaning-making process.

1FB37D81570C41EB92B5F4A1F5E60A3D.description: Consume and produce texts in order to solve problems or influence decisions. (I/C)

DFD9B1CB365E4029B3AABB59B27EAE77.description: Interpret and construct texts to aid the analysis and evaluation of texts and ideas. (I/C)

E1FC487B49FE4D9DBBD64F9F281499CF.description: Explain and learn concepts and processes by interpreting and constructing texts. (I/C)

A63E9C2F154A404DAA61328B1F91C352.description: Make use of texts to build knowledge, develop skills, make informed decisions, and share information and ideas. (I/C)

4240DBEF69FD419091C2185B22DCB1C5.description: Share real or imagined experiences by interpreting and constructing texts that tell or include stories. (I/C)

91425470F78345368272E2A798C35FFE.description: Engagement & Intention Engage in written or spoken dialogue as author and audience for a variety of tasks and purposes, making intentional connections within, between, and beyond texts.

5D31E32AFB0E46219C0D82EFE4935BA5.description: Develop independence and autonomy as a reader and writer. (I/C)

54255038B6154FEAA4493A26D9EB0B69.description: Participate in a community of readers and writers by developing group norms, discussing texts, sharing individual writing, listening as others share their writing, and offering and responding to feedback. (I/C)

453A3BAC79974980B00291F62772A358.description: Build a repertoire of comprehension and composition skills, strategies, and techniques, drawing from them as needed to aid the interpretation and construction of texts. (I/C)

E113474871E5480C8AE57DC7CB00C790.description: Select, read, and write texts of personal interest and academic relevance to grade-level texts and topics. (I/C)

94689B9E8489413FB615771FF0545494.description: Discuss or write about personal and academic reading and writing preferences, referring to specific techniques, topics, modes, and genres that resonate most. (I/C)

F03B2848DD594F32A640EE12A66AF45D.description: Generate, understand, monitor, and discuss personal and academic reading and writing goals, revising as appropriate. (I/C)

FC0A700400864521A099867C245838D1.description: Reader & Writer Identity Build an identity as a reader and writer, developing a repertoire of resources and tools to continuously expand participation as an active consumer and producer of texts.

17A8B0F7B9674C9DA73153D7E57AF8A6.description: Engagement & Intention for Comprehension & Composition Students develop personal and academic identities as readers and writers, approaching texts for a variety of tasks and purposes and engaging in reading and writing processes in order to deepen comprehension and strengthen composition.

96AD2AE0B15C41B7B94FAB6CE4D5D88E.description: Practices (P) Students engage routinely in four literacy practices that ground, shape, and inform the expectations of the Foundations, Language, and Texts domains.

F5709AB69E494D35A284E2BEFACB0B82.description: Write Cursive This progression begins in 3rd grade.

2449D783E4C34A9DB2DFDD6D6D7CBBBA.description: Read Cursive This progression begins in 3rd grade.

9001835247014E7F92A98FD2B5CBAE98.description: Track and maintain speed and efficiency while forming words and sentences.

4BC590ED599748E788E43E6E82CEA5FB.description: Transcription & Handwriting Fluency Use working memory to transcribe oral language to written text and maintain meaning while writing letters, words, and sentences quickly and accurately.

7D7548E7EE694711B29688B387E6AEA5.description: Use appropriate spacing throughout the body of a text.

3FC74EC34CA849C3BAF86C5600D41067.description: Form all uppercase and lowercase letters and words with accuracy, consistency, and efficiency. â€‹

DE2188D1DFAB45E28FD32C03785969E2.description: Motor Skills & Letter/Word Formation Use fine motor skills to form legible letters and words in print.

F3CF66C853FF4FB8B0CCD1E3909D9D70.description: Handwriting Students develop print handwriting skills.

54127574B78642439C6C9B04A406C08E.description: Self-correct while reading text (silently or aloud) to improve comprehension and fluency, rereading as necessary. â€‹

90D39974AFE140229EFCD1A9557E9BE1.description: Read a wide range of grade-level texts aloud with appropriate prosody (phrasing, expression, juncture/pause, and intonation) to demonstrate understanding.

D6949517B00D4C4A81F1F8855A79BC5E.description: Read a wide range of grade-level texts aloud with increasing automaticity.

0B693BDD3B974002B64D7D2C83C13CCB.description: Increase sight word vocabulary using decoding skills by reading grade appropriate regularly and irregularly spelled words, including high-frequency words, in isolation and context with increasing automaticity.

B04CC2E24A7148E5845CC7277EA945B1.description: Oral & Silent Reading Fluency Demonstrate oral and silent reading fluency while reading texts for understanding, self-correcting as necessary to ensure accuracy and aid comprehension.

41FBE0B5F611497A902A05C38A6EE452.description: Fluency Students read text aloud or silently with speed, accuracy, and expression.

1FF942A433984E6BABE431C8FEF8819C.description: Decoding & Encoding with Phonics This progression begins in 3rd grade.

42D4AEB7CE1745E9B22B299308BEEFFD.description: Encode two-syllable words by applying knowledge of all major syllable types.

0B922B059C6A40FE8FA563B673B02410.description: Encode two-syllable nonsense words with a variety of spelling patterns (VVCC, VVCe, VCCC, VVCCC).

6E36C425A44749F1AEDF9C97DB88282A.description: Identify and encode irregularly spelled words, including high-frequency words.

2C81395C3C6D425389186343D37FB306.description: Encode regularly spelled two-syllable words with a variety of spelling patterns (VVCC, VVCe, VCCC, VVCCC) by applying knowledge of basic phonics skills, including high- frequency words.

5DC5136C6E8C473990D3A9606E2EE404.description: Encoding with Phonics Use grade-level phonics skills to encode words in context and in isolation.

AE7C697C1F344B62B63943D220FE09AB.description: Decode two-syllable words by applying knowledge of all major syllable types.

BA143646BAC34933A64B4A460827621B.description: Decode two-syllable nonsense words by applying rules of basic phonics skills (VVCC, VVCe, VCCC, VVCCC).

F3EC543501C84B969933CF79F74F12A7.description: Identify and decode parts of irregularly spelled words, including high-frequency words.

E322574D18A14B2E94A1D3890B2CF7F9.description: Decode regularly spelled two-syllable words with a variety of spelling patterns (VVCC, VVCe, VCCC, VVCCC) by applying knowledge of basic phonics skills, including high-frequency words.

936E5D83B49D4811828A37F4CC3A6FAA.description: Decoding with Phonics Use grade-level phonics skills to decode words in context and in isolation.

600AAB11829E48688062F478CC578004.description: Identify and produce both long and short vowel sounds for A, E, I, O, U, including final -e, vowel digraphs, r-controlled vowels, and diphthongs. â€‹

FE9A390C96B242AB86D14DB44D51934B.description: Identify and produce all phoneme- grapheme correspondences for all consonants, including consonant blends and digraphs.

12B41803D09446B297E96C30D8DEE5F1.description: Phoneme-Grapheme Correspondences Identify and produce phoneme-grapheme correspondences.

A9733DE99A204B8DABC7D470041C0000.description: Phonics Students learn the relationships between the sounds of spoken language and the letters of written language as they decode and encode words in context and in isolation.

8F66F6F534FE4A2A859CADDE6FD63674.description: Concepts of Print This big idea only applies to kindergarten.

13499159E49A4BC58E4474518F3E27F2.description: Phonological Awareness This big idea only applies to kindergarten and 1st grade.

8C7F6615401940E4A4281168937D3990.description: Foundations (F) Students build a foundation for achieving dynamic literacy practices to aid reading comprehension.
